results.title: Kampuchea: the long road back
results.creator_credit: Leonard Teale, John Wall and Canterbury Productions
results.brief_description: Commissioned by the sponsors of the Kampuchean Relief Appeal this made for television documentary shows how donations to International Relief Aid were used to bring aid to Kampuchea. Also records the plight of Kampucheans still struggling for survival after the death and destruction caused by the Pol Pot regime. Narrated by Leonard Teale.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leonard Teale, John Wall and Canterbury Productions

results.title: For Better - For Worse
results.creator_credit: John M. Bale, Don Anderson and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Dramatization of common misconceptions surrounding marriage and the types of stress contributing to marriage breakdown. Refers to alcohol, the consequences of “mateship” and violence.

results.title: Footscray 1911
results.brief_description: Scenes of Footscray around 1911. Shows street scenes, transport, recreation and clothing. Recognizable scenes include Nicholson Street and Forges Store. Footscray Railway Station and Federal Hall.

results.title: The Punter
results.brief_description: A short film about Jack Burnett and his involvment in the horse racing industry in the 1970s. (Jack is the father-in-law of the filmmaker) Identifiable with many students. Could be used for discussion on the idea of bought leisure and deals with gambling relating to horse racing.

results.title: Soft soap
results.brief_description: Antics of Peter and Harry, two dedicated but “out of tune” artists who devote their time obsessively to recreating the characters of Harlequin and Pierrot. Designed to draw attention to the insidious ways in which advertising techniques manipulate the consumer in the market place. Shot in Melbourne. Stars Max Gillies and Joe Bolza.

results.title: Billabong
results.brief_description: Set among the red gums, this film captures the mood of one day on the Murray River, Echuca, Victoria. Shows where thousands of birds come to breed each year.

results.title: Suburban streetscape: living Hawthorn 1906 & 1979
results.creator_credit: Deakin University, Michael Rogers and Weston Bate
results.brief_description: Compares 1906 footage of the main streets of the Melbourne suburb of Hawthorn with footage of the same streets in 1979. Contains b&w footage.

results.title: The Place Across the River
results.creator_credit: David Greig, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description: Explore the rich history of Melbourne through the National Gallery of Victoria site in St Kilda Road, Melbourne, via its various uses, as a circus site in 1887 to the landmark cultural centre it became. Mixes found footage, stills and contemporary footage.

results.title: The Legend of Sleepy Hollow
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow, David Adams and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Visualizes the spectral spirits and twilight superstitions that haunted the drowsy Dutch settlement of Sleepy Hollow. Concerns the rivalry between Ichabod Crane and Brom Bones for the hand of Katrina Van Tassel, and how the Headless Horseman of Sleepy Hollow removes Ichabod from the scene. Screenplay by Joseph Cavella, based on the story by Washington Irving. Narrated by John Carradine.
